intro: Anemonospermos bellidifolia, commonly known as the bellidifolia anemonospermos, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Polygonaceae. It is native to the mountainous regions of South America, particularly in Argentina and Chile. The plant features showy, yellow flowers that bloom in spring, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its leaves are alternate, lance-shaped, and covered in a fine layer of silky hair. The plant is often found in rocky or gravelly soils, thriving in full sun to partial shade conditions.
